clinical_study.brief_title: Promotion of Emotional Well-being in Hospitalized Cancer Patients by Information and Communication Technologies (ICTs)
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of a Brief Psychological Intervention That Uses ICTs to Improve Well-being in Hospitalized Cancer Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to test the efficacy of a brief psychological intervention composed by two therapeutic modules (virtual environments and reminiscence techniques) for the promotion of wellbeing of hospitalized adult cancer patients. Participants are randomly assigned to 2 conditions: intervention condition and control condition.

primary_outcome.measure: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) (Zigmond & Snaith, 1983; adapted version of Tejero, Guimerá, Farré & Peri, 1986)

secondary_outcome.description: Subjective mood change after each session.

secondary_outcome.measure: Visual Analog Scale: Emotional State. Change pre-post sessions.
secondary_outcome.description: positive affect, negative affect, well-being and calmness (5-point Likert scale)

secondary_outcome.measure: Visual Analog Scale: Physical Discomfort. Change pre-post sessions.
secondary_outcome.description: fatigue, pain and nausea-vomiting (5-point Likert scale)

secondary_outcome.measure: Visual Analog Scale: Satisfaction with the Session
secondary_outcome.description: pleasantness and perceived usefulness (5-point Likert scale)

secondary_outcome.measure: Satisfaction with Intervention Scale (adapted version of Borkovec and Nau's, 1972).
secondary_outcome.description: satisfaction, recommendation, utility and discomfort (5-point Likert scale)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time perception (based on Bayés et al., 1997).
secondary_outcome.description: Participants has to indicate the session duration (in minutes). An objective measure of the time lapse is also registered by the researcher.

arm_group.description: Psychological intervention composed by four sessions along 1 week. Participants can interact with virtual environments and a multimedia system for reminiscence purposes.
Participants receive the medical treatment deliver by the hospital. After one week, they have the possibility to receive the psychological intervention.

intervention.description: First and third sessions are dedicated to remember positive and meaningful personal experiences. Second and fourth sessions are oriented to positive emotions by the use of VR. Participants can choose the virtual environment to work with.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adults with any cancer diagnosis
- hospitalized for at least 1 week
- Karnofsky functional state ≥50
- life expectancy ≥2 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- serious psychopathology
- cognitive impairment
